plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to parts of Southern Europe and Western Asia, noted for its clusters of bell-shaped flowers.
plants.funFact: Rhododendron ponticum is known for its invasive characteristics in parts of the UK and Ireland, where it can dominate native ecosystems.

plants.name: Lupinus texensis
plants.description: A species of lupine native to Texas, famous for its vibrant blue flowers forming dense fields in spring.
plants.funFact: The bluebonnet is the state flower of Texas and is celebrated annually with bluebonnet festivals.

plants.name: Magnolia grandiflora
plants.description: A large evergreen tree known for its large, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring and early summer.
plants.funFact: Southern Magnolia flowers can be up to 12 inches in diameter and emit a strong lemony fragrance.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A deciduous tree native to South America, cherished for its bright red, coral-shaped flowers.
plants.funFact: The cockspur coral tree is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay.
